title: Martin PROKS
description: A minimal hugo theme focus on content

items.title: Week 27 (30/06-04/07/2025)
items.content_text: üëæ IT Uv vuild backend hits the production (link). Beautiful write-up on how to speed-up character occurrence in Python (link). üî¨Science Short write up on 2024 nobel price winners professors Hopfield and Hinton for their contribution in AI (link). Interesting how Waddington landscape is portrayed in the article Another milestone for personalized medicine, baby receives personalized CRISPR treatment to correct CPS1 mutation inherited from both parents (link) (link). The mutation is fatal, inability to remove ammonia (side product when protein is broken down) from blood Specific sound frequency can influence gene activity and modulate cell fate (link). Unfortunate statistical mistakes in Sun et al., clearly explained by Lior Pachter (link). üîó Links Thoughts on writing PhD suing Typist (link). spoiler alter: probably not yet as the product is not mature yet Commentary of John Marioni on drug discovery with AI @ Roche(link). üîß Tools shshemi/tabiew: TUI for the table formats bluewave-labs/checkmate: self-hosted monitoring platform keplergl/kepler.gl: Geospatial analysis tools pyutils/line_profiler: Line by line profiling for Python
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • Uv vuild backend hits the production (link).
  • Beautiful write-up on how to speed-up character occurrence in Python (link).

üî¨Science

  • Short write up on 2024 nobel price winners professors Hopfield and Hinton for their contribution in AI (link).
    • Interesting how Waddington landscape is portrayed in the article
  • Another milestone for personalized medicine, baby receives personalized CRISPR treatment to correct CPS1 mutation inherited from both parents (link) (link).
    • The mutation is fatal, inability to remove ammonia (side product when protein is broken down) from blood
  • Specific sound frequency can influence gene activity and modulate cell fate (link).
  • Unfortunate statistical mistakes in Sun et al., clearly explained by Lior Pachter (link).

üîó Links

  • Thoughts on writing PhD suing Typist (link).
    • spoiler alter: probably not yet as the product is not mature yet
  • Commentary of John Marioni on drug discovery with AI @ Roche(link).

üîß Tools

  • shshemi/tabiew: TUI for the table formats
  • bluewave-labs/checkmate: self-hosted monitoring platform
  • keplergl/kepler.gl: Geospatial analysis tools
  • pyutils/line_profiler: Line by line profiling for Python

items.title: Week 26 (23-29/06/2025)
items.content_text: üëæ IT AI talk by Andrej Karpathy which took internet by storm link. Although not the most secure solution for DNS (i.e. TLS), but still nicely visualized link. Youtube’s fake buffering and its breakdown link. Another massive #password leak link. As always 2FA + password manager can help reducing the risk Another great write-up by Cloudflare about blocking large DDoS attack link. If you MacBook gives you buzzing sensation, you are not alone link! Apple time to fix this issue … üî¨Science Scientists identity all kinds of information by collecting just environment DNA in Dublin.link. Could this be done on a large scale to track uprising diseases? Promising tooth implants tested in rats link. Liu’s lab created specialized electrodes from fluorinated elastomers which can be attached and “expand” with developing brain in order to measure neuron activity link. üîó Links Finland introduces sand battery to store heat as a cost-efficient and sustainable alternative link. Timeline of Virtual Cells concept link. DuckLake: Mix of metadata and files link. üîß Tools EbodShojaei/bake: Make formatter and linter axboe/fio: Benchmarking tool for I/O
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • AI talk by Andrej Karpathy which took internet by storm link.
  • Although not the most secure solution for DNS (i.e. TLS), but still nicely visualized link.
  • Youtube’s fake buffering and its breakdown link.
  • Another massive #password leak link.
    • As always 2FA + password manager can help reducing the risk
  • Another great write-up by Cloudflare about blocking large DDoS attack link.
  • If you MacBook gives you buzzing sensation, you are not alone link!
    • Apple time to fix this issue …

üî¨Science

  • Scientists identity all kinds of information by collecting just environment DNA in Dublin.link.
    • Could this be done on a large scale to track uprising diseases?
  • Promising tooth implants tested in rats link.
  • Liu’s lab created specialized electrodes from fluorinated elastomers which can be attached and “expand” with developing brain in order to measure neuron activity link.

üîó Links

  • Finland introduces sand battery to store heat as a cost-efficient and sustainable alternative link.
  • Timeline of Virtual Cells concept link.
  • DuckLake: Mix of metadata and files link.

üîß Tools

  • EbodShojaei/bake: Make formatter and linter
  • axboe/fio: Benchmarking tool for I/O

items.title: Week 24 (09-15/06/2025)
items.content_text: üëæ IT Commentary from Garry Marcus on the latest criticism of LLMs “reasoning” from Apple (link). Interesting notes: LLM might fail from inference outside of training distribution (out-of-distribution), same problem as perceptron The main take home is that LLMs are not thinking, at least based on puzzle examples in the paper OS for public sector by EU, currently POC (link). üî¨Science Focused ultrasound stimulation could be the alternative treatment in future (link). Idea started with chronic inflammation; possible other candidates are diabetes (already tested on mice, pigs and was published) Could be converted into wearable device in future, allowing easy access for anyone üîó Links Marco writes about his own experience with Severely Deficient Autobiographical Memory / Aphantasia (link) TL;DR: Difficulty to recall information through visualization Youtube: Missing Mind’s Eye: Solving the Mystery of Aphantasia DIY budget server for AI/ML (link) Emerging Startup AheadComputing focuses on building the next new CPU (link) Apple really likes to make those API calls (link). üîß Tools resemble-ai/chatterbox: Resemble AI’s first production-grade open source TTS model. AasishPokhrel/shit: This is kinda funny üòÖ.
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • Commentary from Garry Marcus on the latest criticism of LLMs “reasoning” from Apple (link).
    • Interesting notes:
      • LLM might fail from inference outside of training distribution (out-of-distribution), same problem as perceptron
      • The main take home is that LLMs are not thinking, at least based on puzzle examples in the paper
  • OS for public sector by EU, currently POC (link).

üî¨Science

  • Focused ultrasound stimulation could be the alternative treatment in future (link).
    • Idea started with chronic inflammation; possible other candidates are diabetes (already tested on mice, pigs and was published)
    • Could be converted into wearable device in future, allowing easy access for anyone

üîó Links

  • Marco writes about his own experience with Severely Deficient Autobiographical Memory / Aphantasia (link)
    • TL;DR: Difficulty to recall information through visualization
    • Youtube: Missing Mind’s Eye: Solving the Mystery of Aphantasia
  • DIY budget server for AI/ML (link)
  • Emerging Startup AheadComputing focuses on building the next new CPU (link)
  • Apple really likes to make those API calls (link).

üîß Tools

  • resemble-ai/chatterbox: Resemble AI’s first production-grade open source TTS model.
  • AasishPokhrel/shit: This is kinda funny üòÖ.

items.title: Week 23 (02-08/06/2025)
items.content_text: üëæ IT This is why data structure matters, hashmap to reduce tracking of duplicates decreased backup runtime. Fix was submitted to upsteram git repo (link). Analysis of Cloudflare’s Claude-Generated code documented by the team via commit history (link). Machine Learning Mastery back with some useful 10 one-liners in python (link). üî¨Science Likely not surprising but race and ethnicity do align so well with genetic background (link). Bell Labs was all about science and innovation (link). “How do you manage genius? You don’t.” And it worked. - Mervin Kelly Fibers on the surface of cotton seeds dissolved in lithium bromide-water and heat up to high temperature creates transparent material similartly strong to a polycarbonate. It’s biodegradable and can reduce half of CO2 emissions compared to plastic (link). Titanium dioxide which is in food, was shown to dysregulate endocrine system in mice. Although banned in Europe, America still watis for government’s response to the current research (link). üîó Links Great to Simon’s journey to self-hosting (link). Let’s Encrypt tackles zombie clients with pausing/unpausing approach (link). Did you know you can store your data on paper with the right conversion (link)? MonsterUI packs FastHTML with Tailwind to generate quickly web-apps with Python (link). üîß Tools iamgio/quarkdown: another markdown with superpowers onlook-dev/onlook: the Cursor but for designers in mind elebumm/RedditVideoMakerBot: automated reddit videos wandb/wandb: AI developer platform
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • This is why data structure matters, hashmap to reduce tracking of duplicates decreased backup runtime. Fix was submitted to upsteram git repo (link).
  • Analysis of Cloudflare’s Claude-Generated code documented by the team via commit history (link).
  • Machine Learning Mastery back with some useful 10 one-liners in python (link).

üî¨Science

  • Likely not surprising but race and ethnicity do align so well with genetic background (link).
  • Bell Labs was all about science and innovation (link).
    • “How do you manage genius? You don’t.” And it worked. - Mervin Kelly
  • Fibers on the surface of cotton seeds dissolved in lithium bromide-water and heat up to high temperature creates transparent material similartly strong to a polycarbonate. It’s biodegradable and can reduce half of CO2 emissions compared to plastic (link).
  • Titanium dioxide which is in food, was shown to dysregulate endocrine system in mice. Although banned in Europe, America still watis for government’s response to the current research (link).

üîó Links

  • Great to Simon’s journey to self-hosting (link).
  • Let’s Encrypt tackles zombie clients with pausing/unpausing approach (link).
  • Did you know you can store your data on paper with the right conversion (link)?
  • MonsterUI packs FastHTML with Tailwind to generate quickly web-apps with Python (link).

üîß Tools

  • iamgio/quarkdown: another markdown with superpowers
  • onlook-dev/onlook: the Cursor but for designers in mind
  • elebumm/RedditVideoMakerBot: automated reddit videos
  • wandb/wandb: AI developer platform

items.title: Week 22 (25-30/05/2025)
items.content_text: üëæ IT Simon’s initial impression of Devstal from Mistral (link). Namanyay provides very simple yet convincing argument about how to leverage the AI landscape in your day-to-day dev life. It’s not perfect, but it can be simplify some tasks, you just need to figure out which ones (link). Cloudflare proposes HTTP message signature to simplify how to deal with ai bots/crawlers (link). Oddysey introduced model which generates AI video with real-time interaction from user (link). MinIO moves many features behind paywall minio/object-browser. Alternative switch: Garage. Nice tips & tricks on running LLM locally by Kiran (link). üî¨Science FDA pushes initiative to replace animal models for pre-clinical studies by embracing organ-on-a chip or in silico modeling if it offers to be a viable alternative(link). More bones found in the “River of Death” in Alberta, Canada provides great resource to study Pachyrhinosaurus and other dinosaurs (link). New #podcast series A Coffee with CompBio (link) Zeng et al., 2025 develops CellFM model using ERetNet paired with LoRA. Tackling how to extract number of sequenced cells from papers using LLM by Svensson (link). Sikkema et al., 2025 BiorXiv developed MapQC to estimate fitness of mapping between reference and query Energy distance metric (E-distance) measures shift between two distributions (signal-to-noise ratio) üîó Links Internet Archive launches Youtube channel where they stream how they scan material using high-resolution camera, use automated software for cropping and OCR conversion and archive it afterward on microfiche cards (link). Faster Github Actiosn from Blacksmith company with their transparency on security layers (link). Once provide a phone number it will find its way to the interwebs (link). üîß Tools simonw/llm: LLM from terminal simply. awslabs/mountpoint-s3: Mount s3 bucket which is POSIX compliant. antinomyhq/forge: AI assistant directly in terminal. facebookincubator/cinder: Meta’s version of CPython focused on speed performance.
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • Simon’s initial impression of Devstal from Mistral (link).
  • Namanyay provides very simple yet convincing argument about how to leverage the AI landscape in your day-to-day dev life. It’s not perfect, but it can be simplify some tasks, you just need to figure out which ones (link).
  • Cloudflare proposes HTTP message signature to simplify how to deal with ai bots/crawlers (link).
  • Oddysey introduced model which generates AI video with real-time interaction from user (link).
  • MinIO moves many features behind paywall minio/object-browser.
    • Alternative switch: Garage.
  • Nice tips & tricks on running LLM locally by Kiran (link).

üî¨Science

  • FDA pushes initiative to replace animal models for pre-clinical studies by embracing organ-on-a chip or in silico modeling if it offers to be a viable alternative(link).
  • More bones found in the “River of Death” in Alberta, Canada provides great resource to study Pachyrhinosaurus and other dinosaurs (link).
  • New #podcast series A Coffee with CompBio (link)
  • Zeng et al., 2025 develops CellFM model using ERetNet paired with LoRA.
  • Tackling how to extract number of sequenced cells from papers using LLM by Svensson (link).
  • Sikkema et al., 2025 BiorXiv developed MapQC to estimate fitness of mapping between reference and query
    • Energy distance metric (E-distance) measures shift between two distributions (signal-to-noise ratio)

üîó Links

  • Internet Archive launches Youtube channel where they stream how they scan material using high-resolution camera, use automated software for cropping and OCR conversion and archive it afterward on microfiche cards (link).
  • Faster Github Actiosn from Blacksmith company with their transparency on security layers (link).
  • Once provide a phone number it will find its way to the interwebs (link).

üîß Tools

  • simonw/llm: LLM from terminal simply.
  • awslabs/mountpoint-s3: Mount s3 bucket which is POSIX compliant.
  • antinomyhq/forge: AI assistant directly in terminal.
  • facebookincubator/cinder: Meta’s version of CPython focused on speed performance.

items.title: Week 21 (19-24/05/2025)
items.content_text: üëæ IT Well, Google just dropped Veo 3 at I/o Keynote which generates quite realistic shorts videos (link). üî¨Science Long read on about mitochondria, their fascinating history (originally bacteria which was consumed by an ancestral cell long time ago); fascinating functioning thought “social” queues and link to numerous diseases (link). Gharibi et al., 2025 introduces 3D model culturing hESCs towards post-gastrulation amnion. A big milestone as it allows researchers to study and perturb this developmental process in vitro. These models could be provided as an alternative amniotic membranes in future clinical settings (link). Abukar et al., 2025 uses light-sheet microscopy to track hearth development in mouse providing new insights into the intricacies of cell movement and coordination (link). Great podcast episode from Quanta Magazine discussing latest research on how LLM are not as great as initially thought when it comes to learning “new” languages (link). üîó Links Using specialized process to treatment steel with stainless steel, a young startup Allium Engineering can extend the lifetime of steel by making it resistant against corrosion (link). Have I Been Pwned 2.0 is out packing some new features (link). The Semantic Search Engine for ArXiv (link). When you live around Bay Area and you want to save some money on electricity with solar, have a look at this deep dive by Joe (link). üîß Tools langgenius/dify: interface for building LLM apps kortix-ai/suna: open-source generalist #ai-agent jlowin/fastmcp: build MPC fast with Python kamranahmedse/developer-roadmap: yet another developer roadmap mlabonne/llm-course: LLM #course with code deepspeedai/DeepSpeed: library for optimized training apple/ml-fastvlm: run visual encoding on iPhones from #apple bytedance/deer-flow: deep-research framework packed with extra integrations Lightricks/LTX-Video: impressive video generator
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • Well, Google just dropped Veo 3 at I/o Keynote which generates quite realistic shorts videos (link).

üî¨Science

  • Long read on about mitochondria, their fascinating history (originally bacteria which was consumed by an ancestral cell long time ago); fascinating functioning thought “social” queues and link to numerous diseases (link).
  • Gharibi et al., 2025 introduces 3D model culturing hESCs towards post-gastrulation amnion. A big milestone as it allows researchers to study and perturb this developmental process in vitro. These models could be provided as an alternative amniotic membranes in future clinical settings (link).
  • Abukar et al., 2025 uses light-sheet microscopy to track hearth development in mouse providing new insights into the intricacies of cell movement and coordination (link).
  • Great podcast episode from Quanta Magazine discussing latest research on how LLM are not as great as initially thought when it comes to learning “new” languages (link).

üîó Links

  • Using specialized process to treatment steel with stainless steel, a young startup Allium Engineering can extend the lifetime of steel by making it resistant against corrosion (link).
  • Have I Been Pwned 2.0 is out packing some new features (link).
  • The Semantic Search Engine for ArXiv (link).
  • When you live around Bay Area and you want to save some money on electricity with solar, have a look at this deep dive by Joe (link).

üîß Tools

  • langgenius/dify: interface for building LLM apps
  • kortix-ai/suna: open-source generalist #ai-agent
  • jlowin/fastmcp: build MPC fast with Python
  • kamranahmedse/developer-roadmap: yet another developer roadmap
  • mlabonne/llm-course: LLM #course with code
  • deepspeedai/DeepSpeed: library for optimized training
  • apple/ml-fastvlm: run visual encoding on iPhones from #apple
  • bytedance/deer-flow: deep-research framework packed with extra integrations
  • Lightricks/LTX-Video: impressive video generator

items.title: Daily from  2025-05-12
items.content_text: üëæ IT Awesome 14 Advanced Python Features summarized by Edward (link) üî¨Science Quite an old new but did you know that limpet teeth are apparently worlds strongest biological material (only 1mm in legth!)? (link) üîó Links Nehal writes about how few books changed his view on biology and sparked a new exciting journey towards better understanding of life’s mystery (link) A long read about Jack Tramiel and history of Commodore, Atari and his resilience towards ‚ÄúComputers for the masses, not the classes‚Äù. (link) üîß Tools Have you listened yet to your GitHub contribution graph? (link)

üëæ IT

  • Awesome 14 Advanced Python Features summarized by Edward (link)

üî¨Science

  • Quite an old new but did you know that limpet teeth are apparently worlds strongest biological material (only 1mm in legth!)? (link)

üîó Links

items.title: Daily from  2025-05-05
items.content_text: üëæ IT MCP for agents to “talk” with your resume? Is this where the job market will move one day? (link) Imagine coding without a screen using AR glasses and peripherals. Although portable, still quite pricey for my taste (link) üîó Links Nice and clean default settings for macOS (link). Thank you Catalin’s Tech! # Enable tap-to-click for the trackpad defaults write com.apple.AppleMultitouchTrackpad Clicking -bool true defaults -currentHost write -g com.apple.mouse.tapBehavior -int 1 # Disable the .DS file creation defaults write com.apple.desktopservices DSDontWriteNetworkStores -bool true defaults write com.apple.desktopservices DSDontWriteUSBStores -bool true
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • MCP for agents to “talk” with your resume? Is this where the job market will move one day? (link)
  • Imagine coding without a screen using AR glasses and peripherals. Although portable, still quite pricey for my taste (link)

üîó Links

  • Nice and clean default settings for macOS (link). Thank you Catalin’s Tech!
# Enable tap-to-click for the trackpad
defaults write com.apple.AppleMultitouchTrackpad Clicking -bool true
defaults -currentHost write -g com.apple.mouse.tapBehavior -int 1
# Disable the .DS file creation
defaults write com.apple.desktopservices DSDontWriteNetworkStores -bool true
defaults write com.apple.desktopservices DSDontWriteUSBStores -bool true

items.title: Daily from  2025-05-01
items.content_text: üëæ IT It’s happening, pylock.toml is supported by pip and uv and are we experiencing a fight for type checkers? (link) Alex showcases how efficiently export and import sqlite #database - awesome hack! (link) $ sqlite3 explorer.db .dump | gzip -c > explorer.db.txt.gz Ibrahim has enough of bots and fights them with a clever zip bomb (link) üî¨Science Satirical life journey of a PhD student (link). I wonder how many PhDs can relate to this story ü§î üîó Links Thanks to metagenomics, doctors cured Bristol’s eyesight infection by targeted antibiotics treatment. This showcases we need access to precision medicine (link) FDA approves genetically modified pigs using CRISPR which can be safely eaten. The genetic modification boosts immune system of pigs agains 99% of known PRRS viruses. Would you still eat them knowing this? (link) üîß Tools With dataframely you can specify a validation schema for your polars (link)
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • It’s happening, pylock.toml is supported by pip and uv and are we experiencing a fight for type checkers? (link)
  • Alex showcases how efficiently export and import sqlite #database - awesome hack! (link)
    • $ sqlite3 explorer.db .dump | gzip -c > explorer.db.txt.gz
  • Ibrahim has enough of bots and fights them with a clever zip bomb (link)

üî¨Science

  • Satirical life journey of a PhD student (link). I wonder how many PhDs can relate to this story ü§î

üîó Links

  • Thanks to metagenomics, doctors cured Bristol’s eyesight infection by targeted antibiotics treatment. This showcases we need access to precision medicine (link)
  • FDA approves genetically modified pigs using CRISPR which can be safely eaten. The genetic modification boosts immune system of pigs agains 99% of known PRRS viruses. Would you still eat them knowing this? (link)

üîß Tools

  • With dataframely you can specify a validation schema for your polars (link)

items.title: Daily from  2025-04-24
items.content_text: üëæ IT Easy to follow granular explanation of how DeepSeek was trained by Anita from vellum (link) üîó Links Another reminder to keep thinking about #privacy (link) Looks like gladiators really fought wild animal based on some interesting discoveries in York (link) Interesting #history lesson on post-war effect of Agent Orange during Vietnam war. The side effects of the agent are associated to developmental disabilities still today (link) tim shows how he used mitmproxy to track the trackers (link)
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • Easy to follow granular explanation of how DeepSeek was trained by Anita from vellum (link)

üîó Links

  • Another reminder to keep thinking about #privacy (link)
  • Looks like gladiators really fought wild animal based on some interesting discoveries in York (link)
  • Interesting #history lesson on post-war effect of Agent Orange during Vietnam war. The side effects of the agent are associated to developmental disabilities still today (link)

items.title: Daily from  2025-04-23
items.content_text: üëæ IT Interesting take on Model Context Protocol (MCP); it’s not about the data, it’s about how the chatbot will integrate with it (link) üî¨Science #history Margaret Dayhoff who laid foundations for the field of bioinformatics. (link) CT scans can increase a risk of cancer and therefore should be justified before applying them on patients, but beware of limitations of the study. (link) üîó Links SeaCURE tries to remove CO2 from the water to reduce climate change. They do so by converting the sea water more acidic which releases CO2 which is further stored. (link) Latest measurements of toothpaste content reveal high levels of toxic metals way above FDA standard limits. (link) By donating (transplanting) a womb to her younger sister Grace, Grace was able to give birth to a child through in-vitro fertilization (IVF). The womb transplantation was first performed in Sweden in 2014. (link) Personalized humanoids under review (link)
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • Interesting take on Model Context Protocol (MCP); it’s not about the data, it’s about how the chatbot will integrate with it (link)

üî¨Science

  • #history Margaret Dayhoff who laid foundations for the field of bioinformatics. (link)
  • CT scans can increase a risk of cancer and therefore should be justified before applying them on patients, but beware of limitations of the study. (link)

üîó Links

  • SeaCURE tries to remove CO2 from the water to reduce climate change. They do so by converting the sea water more acidic which releases CO2 which is further stored. (link)
  • Latest measurements of toothpaste content reveal high levels of toxic metals way above FDA standard limits. (link)
  • By donating (transplanting) a womb to her younger sister Grace, Grace was able to give birth to a child through in-vitro fertilization (IVF). The womb transplantation was first performed in Sweden in 2014. (link)
  • Personalized humanoids under review (link)

items.title: Daily from 2025-04-21
items.content_text: üëæ IT Work from Martin Karsten where he focuses on optimizing network processing in Linux which can reduce up to 30% CPU consumption, making this interesting use case for data centers. However best results are only possible for high-traffic scenarios (link). Philip Laine writes about his experience with Microsoft forking his Spegel project as Peerd (link) #python PEP 750 accepts t-string (https://davepeck.org/2025/04/11/pythons-new-t-strings/) üî¨Science Scientists show in mice that IL-17 cytokine plays two divergent roles - in amygdala it triggers anxiety but in cortex it promotes social behaviour. The study highlights possible link between immune system and nervous system suggesting possibilities new therapies for neural disorders by affecting modulating immune system (link). üîó Links brainstorm.gg is a website for brainstorming some fun ideas üîß Tools nari-labs/dia is a 1.6B model capable of generating ultra-realistic dialogue with open-weights published on Hugging Face
items.content_html:
üëæ IT

  • Work from Martin Karsten where he focuses on optimizing network processing in Linux which can reduce up to 30% CPU consumption, making this interesting use case for data centers. However best results are only possible for high-traffic scenarios (link).
  • Philip Laine writes about his experience with Microsoft forking his Spegel project as Peerd (link)
  • #python PEP 750 accepts t-string (https://davepeck.org/2025/04/11/pythons-new-t-strings/)

üî¨Science

  • Scientists show in mice that IL-17 cytokine plays two divergent roles - in amygdala it triggers anxiety but in cortex it promotes social behaviour. The study highlights possible link between immune system and nervous system suggesting possibilities new therapies for neural disorders by affecting modulating immune system (link).

üîó Links

  • brainstorm.gg is a website for brainstorming some fun ideas

üîß Tools

  • nari-labs/dia is a 1.6B model capable of generating ultra-realistic dialogue with open-weights published on Hugging Face
